Riot changed "unstoppable" ultimates a while ago so that the champion can still have CC applied to them while the ultimate is happening. They aren't truly "CC immune" 
It doesn't affect the ability but will affect the champion if it hasn't timed out by the time the ability finishes.

Good to know there are people who got my back, and gently points out that I did miss something (and a rather important detail at that). :)

Maybe you can help me out further on something else that's been nagging me... Off-topic, I know, but indulge me for a moment, please; Fiora got changed basically thanks to her kit focusing too much on her ultimate, yes? Where she becomes _untargetable_ for the duration.
_(As I say it: "Some say [old] Fiora used to be just an ult with a pretty face")._
BUT...isn't Master Yi's Q/Alpha Strike working the exact same way, and has done since his day one?

The discussion why Fiora got changed and lost that ability and Master Yi still got his is not one to be taken here, but I just want to know _for sure_ that their abilities actually works/worked the exact same way.

no. 
Or, i should say, he used to be, and got changed exactly because of that. 

Mr. Yi is a champion that runs and people and AAs them.
The AD variant of Mr Yi was always a champion that runs at people and AAs them.
His Alpha strike does a good bit of damage but landing a good alpha strike doesn't win a team fight and (AD build) Mr. Yi was never a champion that was supposed to just land a good alpha strike and win off that.
Consequently with Mr yi you get to trade. He dodges a skill with his Q and maybe blocks another one with E if he's smart, but other than that you get to put damage on him because the bulk of his DPS is just AAing. 

Whereas old fiora was basically get a tiamat and abuse the fact that you can get 5 procs of it with every ult. 
I.E. while she could run at people and AA them, she couldn't do it for any extended duration so was much more about landing 1-2 decent AAs and then ulting... preferably into a bait ball so the tiamat procs will do work.
So in her case, a good portion of her DPS was done during her ult where she could not be touched. 

Now, we can talk about AP yi. But that was changed for exactly the reason of dealing all this damage while not being on the map.

No, no, I'm not talking about damage output and builds here, I only mean the technical aspects of how Yi's Q works specifically.

Let me try to clarify:
As far as I know, using Yi's Q does make him untargetable for the duration (same as Fiora), 
using his Q can, if timed correctly, block/dodge single-target abilities (same as Fiora), 
and his Q is undodgable if being targeted specifically or residing within range (same as Fiora).

So if we ignore how builds affect or change the damage outputs of the two abilities (Alpha Strike/former Bladewaltz), are there any technical differences between how they work?

I've always believed there are none. Which, as a fan of the old Fiora, I consider highly unfair treatment. 
But, and this is my point, my beliefs on this may be biased and incorrect due to a lack of knowledge on how the two abilities really works, and if there actually are differences (albeit subtle ones).

I think the question that is important is not what the technical differences are, but rather:

a. how much can you do, if you do not have access to this ability? Do you have a follow up to after it ends? do you have a setup that you can/need to do before you use it? Is there anything Mr Yi. is good for, outside of alpha strike?

b. how much are you getting done, while being in the untargetable state? Is it a bit of damage and a dodged skill and after that you need to have some good follow up, or have you just won the team fight  right there? Are you doing the equivalent of a single AOE skill in damage, or are you fully DPSing whilst being CC-immune? 

Technically alpha strike and blade waltz are similar but not identical. Blade waltz procs on-hits and interacts with AA modifiers including defensive ones (yes shen's circle will completely delete blade waltz's effect), alpha strike is pure damage. I think Blade waltz also "waits out" momentary untargetability effects instad of canceling, and it doesn't reset firoa's position if it cancels or kills target. 

Fiora has one thing that is a problem in her kit. Her "gameplay fantasy" is me>you. Which is something you can't ever really give regardless of "oh she's supposed to be a duelist".
